physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Atrophy of the distal right upper extremity primarily in the extensor forearm and bilateral scapular winging, right worse than left. Strength in the upper extremities: Medical Research Council right/left: shoulder abduction 3−/5, shoulder external rotation 4/5, elbow flexion 4/4+, elbow extension 4/5, forearm supination 2/4, wrist extension 0/3−, wrist flexion 4/4, finger extension 0/0, finger flexion (deep) 4−/4, finger abduction 4/4, thumb abduction 2/4, thumb flexion 0/4. Normal strength in the lower extremities. Areflexia in the upper extremities, 2+ reflexes in lower extremities.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Weakness worsened to near-paralysis of right wrist and fingers and muscle atrophy noted. Symptoms persisted and evolved with new weakness in the right shoulder and increased tingling in the right hand, and new symptoms in the left hand.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Decreased amplitude of sensory responses in nerve conduction studies showing absent right radial sensory response and decreased left radial and bilateral median responses. EMG showed fibrillation potentials or positive sharp waves (Fibs/PSWs) in deltoid, pronator teres, and extensor digitorum communis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicated progression of denervation in the distribution of the axillary, median, and radial nerves.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Improved fine motor ability enabling the patient to clip fingernails, but still reported ongoing pain and sensory abnormalities.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Gradual improvement in weakness over time with supportive care.
